solidify.ENG: to become solid or make something solid

dazzle.ENG: if a very bright light dazzles you, it stops you from seeing properly for a short time

transplant.CHS: 移植（器官、皮肤等）；移植，移种（植物）
transplant.ENG: to move an organ, piece of skin etc from one person’s body and put it into another as a form of medical treatment

xerox.ENG: to make a copy of a letter, document, etc. by using Xerox or a similar process

peck.ENG: (of birds) to move the beak forward quickly and hit or bite sth

trot.ENG: the movement of a horse at trotting speed

ridicule.ENG: unkind laughter or remarks that are intended to make someone or something seem stupid

chatter.ENG: continuous rapid talk about things that are not important

sneer.ENG: an unkind smile or remark that shows you have no respect for something or someone

boycott.ENG: an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

endeavor.ENG: an attempt to do something new or difficult

scramble.ENG: a difficult climb in which you have to use your hands to help you

flap.ENG: the noisy movement of something such as cloth in the air

slaughter.ENG: when large numbers of people are killed in a cruel or violent way

tow.ENG: an act of pulling a vehicle behind another vehicle, using a rope or chain

credit.ENG: the belief that something is true or correct

counter.ENG: to be the opposite of something

bulletin.ENG: an official statement that tells people about something important

allowance.ENG: an amount of money that you are given regularly or for a special purpose
